title: EM Likely to See Negative GDP Growth This Year: JPMorgan
description: May.13 -- JPMorgan Head of Emerging Market Economics & Commodities Research Jahangir Aziz forecasts negative GDP growth this year for emerging markets. He speaks on "Bloomberg Markets Asia; China Open".

title: Philippine Economy Contracts for First Time Since 1998 on Shutdowns
description: May.06 -- The Philippine economy contracted in the first quarter as stringent lockdown measures to contain the coronavirus outbreak shut most businesses and sapped consumption. Gross domestic product fell 0.2% in the first quarter compared to a year ago. It was the first contraction since the fourth quarter of 1998. Priyanka Kishore, head of Southeast Asia and India economics at Oxford Economics, shares her reaction to the latest data on "Bloomberg Markets: Asia."

title: Why the latest GDP numbers aren't telling the full story behind COVID-19
description: David Prince of Harbinger Capital Markets Research talks about what economic and market activity investors should be watching.

title: Canada's debt-to-GDP could balloon to more than 48% with current federal aid, says PBO
description: Yves Giroux, parliamentary budget officer joins BNN Bloomberg for a look at their latest report on how government spending could translate into economic costs for Canada. He also says he is sure Ottawa is looking at how to reduce the deficit, but it is not the right time to speak about it publicly.

title: Bringing Canada's economy out of COVID-19 will 'likely take a decade': Former deputy PM
description: John Manley, is senior advisor at Bennett Jones as well as former finance minister and former deputy prime minister. He discusses the future of Canada's economy post COVID-19 pandemic. He notes that once government-mandated shutdown ends, it will take some time for consumer confidence, supply chains and businesses to get stabilize.

title: February GDP data 'doesn't bode well overall for the first quarter'
description: Canada's economy stalled in February even before the COVID-19 crisis took hold. There was no growth in the month, wheras economists were expected a 0.1 per cent gain. As BNN Bloomberg's Greg Bonnell explains, this "doesn't bode well overall for the first quarter."

title: South Korea’s Economy Shrinks Most Since 2008 Amid Virus Outbreak
description: Apr.22 -- Angela Hsieh, regional economist at Barclays Asia Pacific, discusses the outlook for South Korea's economy and policies. The economy suffered its worst contraction since the global financial crisis in the first quarter as the spread of the coronavirus hit consumer spending and business activity. Hsieh speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia."

title: IMF Sees Weakest China GDP Growth for 2020 Since Mid 1970s
description: Apr.16 -- Helge Berger, China mission chief at the International Monetary Fund, discusses the outlook for the world's second-largest economy amid the coronavirus outbreak. First quarter GDP data, year-to-date investment, plus retail sales, industrial output and unemployment figures for March will be released at 10:00 a.m. local time Friday. Berger speaks on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Australia."

title: Japan Quarterly GDP May Plunge as Much as 20%, EY-Parthenon Says
description: Apr.08 -- Nobuko Kobayashi, partner at EY-Parthenon, discusses how the coronavirus outbreak is affecting the Japanese economy. The economy is headed for a double-digit contraction this quarter as increased restrictions on movement add to the impact of the coronavirus, according to economists surveyed by Bloomberg. Kobayashi speaks on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia."

title: PBO says GDP could slip to weakest on record since 1962 amid oil crash and virus woes in scenario analysis
description: Parliamentary Budget Officer Yves Giroux talks about his latest report evaluating the implications of COVID-19 and the oil crash. He talks about the potential economic and fiscal implications of the current environment.

title: Singapore’s First Quarter GDP Plunges
description: Mar.25 -- Singapore releases its GDP data for the first quarter. Bloomberg’s Enda Curran reports on “Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia.”

title: RBC economist says Canada is in for a second-quarter contraction over COVID-19
description: Vice President and Deputy Chief Economist at RBC, Dawn Desjardins says RBC forecasts a 50 basis points cut in April with another 25 basis points cut in June to cushion Canada's economy from the blows dealt by COVID-19 and low oil prices.

title: Evercore ISI's Hyman Predicts Zero U.S. Growth, China GDP 'Armageddon'
description: Mar.04 -- Evercore ISI Chairman Ed Hyman discusses his forecast for economic growth in the U.S. and China amid the coronavirus outbreak. He speaks with Bloomberg's Vonnie Quinn and Guy Johnson on "Bloomberg Markets."

title: Germany GDP Stagnates in Fourth Quarter
description: Feb.25 -- Anna Titareva, European economist at UBS Group AG, discusses Germany’s economy and the country’s exposure to the coronavirus. She speaks on “Bloomberg Markets: European Open.”

title: Canada needs to 'rethink its linear transportation infrastructure': Researcher
description: Kent Fellows, research associate at the School of Public Policy at the University of Calgary, joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss the economic consequences of the Coastal GasLink protests. He says that Canada could lose $60 to $160 million per week if a solution isn't found.

title: Coronavirus impact on GDP will be more pronounced than with SARS: Economist
description: Frances Donald, global chief economist and head of macro strategy at Manulife Investment Management, joins BNN Bloomberg to discuss the coronavirus impact on the global economy.

title: Why U.S. GDP Issues Go Beyond the Boeing Blame Game
description: Feb.10 -- Bloomberg’s Michael McKee examines the issues outside of the grounding of the Boeing 737 Max jetliner that are holding back U.S. economic growth. He speaks on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: China GDP Growth to be 5.3% in 2020, Says Moody’s Analytics
description: Feb.09 -- Steven Cochrane, chief APAC economist at Moody’s Analytics, discusses the spread of coronavirus and its impact on China’s economy. He speaks with Shery Ahn on “Bloomberg Markets.”

title: Our China GDP Forecast Revised to 5.4% in 2020, Says Moody’s Analytics
description: Feb.04 -- Katrina Ell, economist at Moody’s Analytics, discusses the spread of coronavirus and its impact on Chinese growth. She speaks on “Bloomberg Markets.”

title: Expecting significant cuts to China's GDP
description: The full economic impact from the coronavirus won't be known for some time, but Chris Beauchamp, market analyst at IG in London, says we should expect significant cuts to China's economic growth. Beauchamp also explains how domestic stocks the U.K. compare with European equities.

title: What to make of Canada's GDP data
description: Brett House, vice-president and deputy chief economist at Scotiabank, offers insight into the latest report on the Canadian economy and how it could impact on the direction of interest rates and the dollar.

title: Utilities largest upward contributor to Canadian GDP in November
description: The economy grew slightly more than expected in November, mainly because unseasonably cold weather in much of the country propped up the utilities sector. Shelly Hagan of Bloomberg News reports.

title: U.S. GDP Grew at 2.1% in Fourth Quarter as Consumption Moderates
description: Jan.30 -- U.S. gross domestic product expanded at a 2.1% annualized rate for a second straight quarter, while growth in consumer spending decelerated to a 1.8% pace. Bloomberg Intelligence’s Ira Jersey breaks down the data on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: Virus a Downside Risk for China First-Quarter GDP: Oxford Economics
description: Jan.28 -- Sian Fenner, senior Asia economist at Oxford Economics, discusses the spread of the coronavirus and how it could impact China’s first-quarter GDP. She speaks on “Bloomberg Markets.”

title: Facebook’s Mendelsohn: GDPR Has Changed Facebook
description: Jan.23 -- Nicola Mendelsohn, EMEA vice president at Facebook, discusses the mood surrounding tech companies, regulation and their business in India. She speaks exclusively with Bloomberg’s Francine Lacqua at the World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland on “Bloomberg Markets: European Open.”

title: Facebook’s Mendelsohn: GDPR Has Changed Facebook
description: Jan.23 -- Nicola Mendelsohn, EMEA vice president at Facebook, discusses the mood surrounding tech companies, regulation and their business in India. She speaks exclusively with Bloomberg’s Francine Lacqua at the World Economic Forum’s annual meeting in Davos, Switzerland on “Bloomberg Markets: European Open.”

title: China trying to shift economy away from 'bingeing on debt'
description: Bloomberg’s Justina Lee has more on the latest Chinese GDP numbers.

title: China's economy grew 6% in fourth quarter as demand stabilized
description: China’s economy stabilized last quarter after slowing to the weakest pace in almost three decades, with the first acceleration in investment since June signalling that a firmer recovery could be underway. Colin Cieszynski, chief market strategist at SIA Wealth Management, joins BNN Bloomberg's Paul Bagnell to discuss.

title: U.S. debt has become detached from growth and GDP: James Grant
description: James Grant, founder of Grant's Interest Rate Observer, discusses the growing gross debt in the U.S.

title: Canadian economy shrinks in Oct. as GM strike in U.S. hits manufacturing
description: Canada’s economy unexpectedly shrank in October as the General Motors strike in the U.S. took a toll on the manufacturing sector. Shelly Hagan of Bloomberg News reports from Ottawa.

title: The Big Three: Final GDP report of 2019; TSX hits record high; China to cut tariffs on U.S. goods
description: Brooke Thackray, research analysts at Horizons ETF Management, joins BNN Bloomberg's Paul Bagnell to break down the top stories we're tracking.

title: Japan to Post 'Pretty Bad' GDP Numbers, BofAML's Devalier Says
description: Dec.17 -- Izumi Devalier, head of Japan economics at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, talks about the economy and monetary policy. The Bank of Japan will likely hold pat at its meeting this week amid signs of a thaw in global trade tensions and the launch of a government stimulus package that have improved the growth outlook. Exports fell 7.9% in November year-on-year, while imports dropped 15.7%. Devalier speaks with Shery Ahn and Paul Allen on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Asia."

title: China to Do Whatever Needed to Double 2020 GDP vs. 2010: StanChart
description: Dec.11 -- David Mann, chief global economist at Standard Chartered, talks about China's economy and policies. China is expected to offer some details on its 2020 economic strategy later on Thursday, signaling how it will balance controlling the slowdown in growth with fending off financial risks and managing the trade war. Mann also discusses India's growth outlook with Tom Mackenzie, Yvonne Man and David Ingles on "Bloomberg Markets: China Open."

title: GDP slows, but plenty of good signs below the headline
description: Bloomberg’s Managing Editor for Canada Dave Scanlan reports on some good news from the latest GDP report.

title: Why Deutsche Bank Sees Treasury Yields Trailing GDP for Decades
description: Nov.27 -- Jim Reid, global head of fundamental credit strategy at Deutsche Bank, discusses Treasury yields, the U.S. economy and the need for fiscal policy to play a bigger role in supporting future growth in the world’s largest economy. "For the rest of my career, I think nominal yields will be below nominal GDP,” Reid said yesterday on "Bloomberg Surveillance." In a note published Wednesday, Reid said he might need to work until the 2040s.

title: U.S. 3Q GDP Grew at 2.1% Pace, Revised Up From 1.9%
description: Nov.27 -- Steven Ricchiuto, chief U.S. economist at Mizuho Americas, and Walter Todd, chief investment officer at Greenwood Capital, examine revised third-quarter U.S. economic growth and durable goods orders. They speak on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: Hong Kong Cuts 2019 GDP Forecast to -1.3% Amid Protests
description: Nov.15 -- Hong Kong revised down its economic growth estimate for this year, forecasting the first annual contraction since the global financial crisis. Bloomberg’s Jeff Black reports on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Finance Minster Scholz Sees No Need for Stimulus as Germany Dodges Recession
description: Nov.14 -- German Finance Minister Olaf Scholz said the nation’s economy doesn’t need a boost from additional spending, saying “it’s good to know that we don’t have a crisis.” Scholz spoke at a Bloomberg News event in Berlin.

title: Germany Narrowly Dodges Recession as Third-Quarter GDP Expands 0.1%
description: Nov.14 -- Germany avoided its first recession in six years with a surprise 0.1% expansion in the third-quarter. Bloomberg’s Chad Thomas reports on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Allianz Expects Germany to Avoid Recession in Third Quarter
description: Nov.11 -- Ludovic Subran, chief economist at Allianz, discusses expectations for the German economy ahead of this week’s GDP report. He speaks with Bloomberg’s Anna Edwards on "Bloomberg Markets: European Open."

title: A Weak Dollar Trend Persists in the Near-Term, Says Citi’s Hollenhorst
description: Nov.01 -- Andrew Hollenhorst, chief U.S. economist at Citi, discusses his outlook for the U.S. dollar and GDP expectations for the next 12 months. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance."

title: Canada's GDP growth stunted by drop in wholesale trade
description: Canada's economy expanded a little less than expected at 0.1 per cent in August, with wholesale trade as the biggest drag. Erik Hertzberg of Bloomberg News reports.

title: McCreath: Don't see a dove behind the Fed's hawkish cut
description: BNN Bloomberg Commentator Andrew McCreath goes deeper into economic reports released by European Union, China and the U.S. He says that China is weakening in several different economic sectors, Europe remains generally unchanged, and the U.S. hawkish cut foreshadows weakening growth for the mid-term.

title: U.S. GDP Didn’t Validate Fears of Downside Risks: Invesco’s de Longis
description: Oct.30 -- Kathryn Rooney-Vera, head of research and strategy at Bulltick, and Alessio de Longis, senior portfolio manager at Invesco Investment Solutions, examine U.S. third-quarter economic growth of 1.9%. They speak with Bloomberg’s Alix Steel on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: U.S. Economy Grew at 1.9% Pace in Third-Quarter
description: Oct.30 -- The U.S. economy expanded more than forecast in the third-quarter, growing at a 1.9% annualized rate, topping forecasts calling for 1.6% growth. Bloomberg’s Michael McKee reports on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: Latest U.S. GDP data could lead to shift in language from the Fed today: Strategist
description: Karl Schamotta, chief market strategist at Cambridge Global Payments, joins BNN Bloomberg to weigh in on the latest U.S. GDP data, which saw the U.S. economy expand more than forecasted in the third quarter. GDP expanded at a 1.9 per cent annualized rate.

title: The Big Three: Election in dead heat; China's GDP lowest since 1992, Brexit vote this weekend
description: Allan Meyer, director and portfolio manager at Wickham Investment Council, joins BNN Bloomberg's Paul Bagnell to weigh in on the top stories we're tracking this morning.

title: Commodities update: Oil and gas drags on Canadian GDP; WTO cuts global forecast
description: BNN Bloomberg's Andrew Bell looks at the latest movements in gold, oil, natural gas and marijuana stocks.

title: Canada's GDP growth stalls in July amid oil and gas slowdown
description: Canada's GDP was unchanged in July from a 0.2 per cent gain in June, Statistics Canada said Tuesday. BNN Bloomberg's Jon Erlichman discusses the latest data with TD Securities' Chief Canada Strategist Andrew Kelvin, and how it may impact potential rate moves at the Bank of Canada.

title: ADB Cuts Developing Asia 2019 GDP Forecast to 5.4%
description: Sep.25 -- Yasuyuki Sawada, chief economist at Asian Development Bank, discusses cutting its growth forecast for developing Asia and his outlook for China’s economy. He speaks on “Bloomberg Markets: Asia.”
